text.p: Here is the region between the graphs [mathjaxinline]x = y^2[/mathjaxinline], [mathjaxinline]x+y = 6[/mathjaxinline], and [mathjaxinline]y = -1[/mathjaxinline]. We wish to find the volume of the solid obtained by rotating this region around the line [mathjaxinline]y = -1[/mathjaxinline].
If we integrate with respect to [mathjaxinline]x[/mathjaxinline], the rectangles would become what shape when rotated?
How many different integrals would we need to set up if we did that?
If we integrate with respect to [mathjaxinline]y[/mathjaxinline], the rectangles would become what shape when rotated?
How many different integrals would we need to set up if we did that?
